findingType.description: A generic warning from the JavaDoc tool.

findingType.shortDescription: (@inheritDoc) used but the element does not override or implement any method.
findingType.description: The {@inheritDoc} tag can only be used when there exists some inherited element. Please remember that constructors are not inherited.
findingType.pattern: (@inheritDoc) used but (.*) does not override or implement any method\.

findingType.shortDescription: (@return) tag cannot be used in method with void return type.
findingType.description: The method does not return any value, so there is no use of a @return tag.
findingType.pattern: @return tag cannot be used in method with void return type\.

findingType.shortDescription: The parameter described with the @param tag does not exist.
findingType.pattern: @param argument "(.*)" is not a parameter name\.

findingType.description: The tag points to a reference that could not be found. It might be caused by a typo in the target or also in a missing class on the classpath while generating javadoc.

findingType.shortDescription: The used tag is not known.
findingType.description: The tag used is not known to java doc. Might be a doclet definition is missing or a typo in the tag name?

findingType.shortDescription: The used tag is not suitable in this context.
findingType.description: The use of the tag is limited to the listed places.
findingType.pattern: Tag (.*) cannot be used in (.*) documentation\. ?It can only be used in the following types of documentation: (.*)\.

findingType.shortDescription: The local target of the tag can not be fond.
Data on the given Url could not be loaded.
findingType.description: Data on the given Url could not be loaded. Might be because the network is temporarily not available or the resource does not exist.
